cab.content: " n BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken laensure the secrecy of this document(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)MOST^SECRET,W.P.U1) 79.8TH MARCH, 1941,WAR CABINET,COPY NO.The telegram set out below from the admiral commanding the Battle Cruisers to the Admiralty is circulated to members of the War Cabinet by direction ofthe Prime Minister.(Signed) E.E. BRIDGES.Great George Street, S.W.1,8TH MARCH, 1941.Date.Time.6.4.41,1225.Addressed. C. in C. Home Fleet.Repeated Admiralty.281. After due consideration recent patrol carriedout "by H.M.S. HOOD and 2 Cruisers in vicinity 043 degs.H, 018 degs. W. I am of the opinion that if our seapatrols are to block exit from Brest with a good chance ofsuccess there are 2 main requirements. The first isaddition of an aircraft carrier to our Force. Second isprovision of a fully defended base in south west Ireland.As regards latter I feel that increased protection thatsuch a base would give to our shipping is so great that nothing should be allowed to stand in the way of ouracquiring one.
